page.title: 01The Devonshire Dialect 1
page.content:
Much of the Devonshire Dialect is still to be heard in and around Swimbridge School, North Devon, during the Summer of 1985. Here is a selection of the most common words and phrases:
grockle = tourist teddi or tetti = potato git awm = get on or get home gert = big dap = rubber play-shoe to = often added onto the end of a sentence relating to a place or position; e.g.{Wer's it to ? = Where {is it ? tacker = little boy he'm = him or used to humanise an object; e.g. {he'm in attic = it is in {the attic
